title: HVAC & QMS Engineer | Pharmaceutical Industry | Taloja - Navi Mumbai
tagsAndSkills: HVAC Engineering,QMS Implementation,Pharmaceutical,Engineering,QMS,HVAC
jobDescription:
Quality Management System (QMS) Engineer:

Job Title: QMS Engineer

Job Overview: The QMS Engineer plays a crucial role in ensuring that the Quality Management System is effectively implemented and maintained within the pharmaceutical manufacturing environment. This role involves designing, developing, and optimizing processes to meet quality standards, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.

Responsibilities:

  1. QMS Development: Design, implement, and maintain the Quality Management System to ensure compliance with regulatory standards (e.g., FDA, GMP).
  2. Documentation Control: Oversee the documentation processes, including creation, revision, and control of quality documents, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and other relevant records.
  3. Audits and Inspections: Plan, conduct, and participate in internal and external audits to assess compliance with quality standards. Prepare for and support regulatory inspections.
  4. Continuous Improvement: Identify areas for process improvement and work with cross-functional teams to implement changes that enhance the overall quality of products and processes.
  5. Training and Education: Provide training on quality systems and procedures to employees. Ensure that all personnel are aware of and compliant with QMS requirements.
  6. Risk Management: Implement risk management strategies and processes to identify, assess, and mitigate risks to product quality.
  7. CAPA (Corrective and Preventive Actions): Lead investigations into quality issues, implement corrective actions, and develop preventive measures to address recurring problems.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or related field.
  • Previous experience in quality management within the pharmaceutical industry.
  • Knowledge of relevant regulations and standards (e.g., cGMP, FDA guidelines).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


HVAC Engineer:

Job Title: HVAC Engineer

Job Overview: The HVAC Engineer in the pharmaceutical industry is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems to ensure the optimal environmental conditions for pharmaceutical manufacturing processes.

Responsibilities:

  1. System Design: Design HVAC systems that meet the specific requirements of pharmaceutical manufacturing facilities, considering factors such as cleanroom classifications, temperature control, and air quality.
  2. Installation and Maintenance: Oversee the installation, commissioning, and ongoing maintenance of HVAC systems to ensure they operate efficiently and meet regulatory standards.
  3. Compliance: Ensure that HVAC systems comply with relevant regulations and standards, including those related to cleanroom design and operation.
  4. Monitoring and Validation: Implement monitoring systems to continuously assess the performance of HVAC systems. Conduct validation activities to ensure systems meet specified requirements.
  5. Energy Efficiency: Identify opportunities for energy efficiency improvements in HVAC systems without compromising product quality or compliance.
  6. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including quality assurance, manufacturing, and facility management, to address HVAC-related issues and support production processes.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
  • Experience in HVAC system design and maintenance, preferably in a pharmaceutical or regulated industry.
  • Knowledge of cleanroom requirements and regulatory guidelines.
  • Familiarity with HVAC control systems.
  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Good communication and collaboration skills.

* Interested Applicant can send cv on shital@mjbiopharm.com or contact on 9619744167.
